intro: Herschelianthe longilabris, commonly known as the long-lipped hesperalata, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. The plant features opposite leaves that are often lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by horticulturists.
